actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the Postal Service may not close any post office serving a rural area or a small community or town unless such closing is approved by the Congress.

summary.text: Directs the United States Postal Service to transmit a statement to each House of Congress explaining the reasons for any proposed closing of a post office which serves a rural area or small community. Requires approval by either House of Congress before any such closing may become effective.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the Postal Service may not close any post office serving a rural area or a small community or town unless such closing is approved by the Congress.
